title: Matrix variate beta distribution
summary: In statistics, the matrix variate beta distribution is a generalization of the beta distribution.  If U {\displaystyle U} is a p × p {\displaystyle p\times p} positive definite matrix with a matrix variate beta distribution, and a , b > ( p − 1 ) / 2 {\displaystyle a,b>(p-1)/2} are real parameters, we write U ∼ B p ( a , b ) {\displaystyle U\sim B_{p}\left(a,b\right)} (sometimes B p I ( a , b ) {\displaystyle B_{p}^{I}\left(a,b\right)} ).  The probability density function for U {\displaystyle U} is:
